conclusion: Isosceles prism ABC with vertex angle θ = 30°, side length of AB is L, light ray DO hits midpoint O of side AB, incident angle i = 45°, light exits perpendicular to side AC, light speed in vacuum is C
Angle BAC = Angle CAB = 30°, Angle ABC = Angle BCA = 75°
Snell's law at point O gives sin(45°) = n sin(r), where r is the angle of refraction
The angle r is labeled as γ in the second image
Light travels from O to point J on side AC, angle γ is the angle of refraction, angle between refracted ray and normal to AC is labeled as y
Since light exits perpendicular to AC, angle of incidence at J must be 0°
Snell's law at point J gives n sin(0°) = sin(0°), satisfied regardless of n
Angle between refracted ray and side AB is γ, angle between refracted ray and side AC is y
For light to exit perpendicular to AC, y = 0°, angle between sides AB and AC is 30°, therefore angle γ must be 60°
Using Snell's law at point O, n = √2/√3
Distance from O to J is labeled as L/2 in the third image
The propagation time of light in the prism is √2L/(2√3C)
